title: Pan fried sea bass with cucumber salsa

For the salsa: 2 tbsp, finely chopped, fresh mint leaves
2 tbsp, finely chopped, fresh coriander leaves
For the sea bass: 4 x 175g/6 1/4oz sea bass fillets, skin on
12 small tiger prawns, peeled and de-veined

steps: To make the salsa combine the cucumber, tomato, red onion, chilli, mint and coriander in a bowl. Add the rice vinegar and soya sauce. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground pepper.
Meanwhile, for the sea bass, heat a large non-stick frying pan. When hot, add the butter and put the fish fillets skin-side down on it. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Carefully turn the fish fillets and add prawns to the pan. Cook for further 2-3 minutes. Remove from pan.
Tip the spring onions and mangetout into the pan used for the fish, cook for 2-3 minutes or until just tender.

To serve, divide the salsa between the plates, top with the spring onions and mangetout and place the fish on top skin-side up. Arrange the prawns around the plates and squeeze over a little lime juice.
